Description: Architectural caprice; large columns with trees behind at centre, broken frieze and pillars on ground at r, colonnade and pyramid in distance at l, in a circle Pen and brown ink, with grey wash Verso: Studies of centaurs; six studies in various reclining positions Pen and brown ink
Curator's comments: Walter Friedlaender and Antony Blunt's suggestion that this was by Jean Lemaire, an attribution supported by Pierre Rosenberg and Louis- Antoine Prat, was confirmed by the publication of a related painting of the 'Rest on the Flight into Egypt' in a private collection, see Fagiolo Dell'Arco 1996, no. 47, p. 204. The circular composition of the canvas shares with the drawing the foreground architectural setting including the Orestes sarcophagus (broken and reversed in the picture), based on now in the Vatican, and the pyramidical monument on top of another sarcophagus approached through a grandiose portico. The temple in the drawings is replaced by an obelisque in the picture. The BM work is one of only a dozen drawings by the artist, four of which are in the Albertina, Vienna. Lit.: J.C.
